SENT.plain: Seventy-eight carotid endarterectomy specimens were reviewed microscopically for the presence of mural capillary atheromatous emboli
Twelve specimens (15%) were found to contain these emboli

An attempt to correlate this finding with clinical and radiologic data yielded no evidence of an increased predisposition to recurrent transient ischemic attacks or stroke in the affected patients even in the absence of ulceration
Nevertheless, further attention must be given to defining the drainage patterns of such embolized mural capillaries and elucidating their role, if any, in the pathophysiology of stroke
